videos.title: Triple Bun Updo | Homecoming Hairstyles | Easy DIY Hairstyle | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
If you have ever visited Texas in the summer you know how important cute, easy DIY undo hairstyles can become!  It's so hot and getting your hair off your neck with a DIY undo is the perfect hairstyle to pair with a fun dress or even a work outfit.  
This hairstyle is even more awesome because it can so easily translate into a homecoming hairstyle, a prom hairstyle, or even a hairstyle for any other special event.  This simple beginner hairstyle is made up of three simple braids which means that anyone can do it!  Even if your looking for a DIY hairstyle!  
After creating three ponytails, you add braids to each one to create braided buns.  Twist the buns up and bobby pin in place and voila you have a great easy DIY undo!  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHTripleBunUpdo

videos.title: Lace Pull Thru Braid | Rosette Bun | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
I seriously can't get enough of Pull Thru Braids!  They are such simple hairstyles to do and certainly easy hairstyles for even a beginner to pull off.  You don't even need to know how to braid since the Pull Thru braid is really a faux braid!  

In this easy DIY hairstyle tutorial I took the pull thru braid to a new level by adding hair ONLY from one side to create a lace braid effect. 
I then used a regular three strand braid to create a nice rosette bun at the end of the simple Pull Thru braid.  In the end I have a gorgeous hairstyle that looks amazing! 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHLacePullThru

videos.title: Braid Bun Combo | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Check out this darling hairstyle that is a combination of braids, twist, flips, and a bun. Sounds complicated right?  But guess what it really isn't.  Surprisingly this cute hairstyle is simply a creation using four different elements...but all four are SIMPLE hairstyle elements!  

You begin by creating two dutch braids on either side of the middle part line.  Then you take some hair sections and add them to the dutch braids to create a ponytail.  Flipping the ponytail under creates a cute pop to the whole hairstyle and if you pancake the sides it suddenly looks like a boho hairstyle!

After that you simply create two twists and roll them around to form a bun.  It's so easy!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHBraidBunCombo

videos.title: 3 Prom Hairstyles | Updo | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
It's springtime and nearly Prom season which means girls all around the world are watching prom vlogs, prom makeup tutorials, and prom grwm videos frantically trying to decide which prom hairstyles, prom dress, and prom makeup to wear!   Have you finished your prom get ready with me plans? Or finished your last minute prom dress shopping? Or if your early in the prom season for your school have you decided on your promposal?  

Have no fear because this video is about to show you 3 Prom Hairstyles that are all adorable, would look great with any prom dress, and are still an easy DIY.   You won't even need mom to schedule a hairdresser appointment or beg your best friend to do it! 
The first style is two basic fishtails that are knotted together and then bobby pinned in place.  Add some gorgeous curls and you are set to go.  

The second prom hairstyle is created by taking two dutch braids from either side of the head and wrapping them around a low braided bun.  This prom hairstyle will keep your shoulders cooler and keep you from sweating too much as your dancing the night away. 

The third style is a faux braid.  That's right!  A faux braid!  You don't even need to know how to do a simple three strand braid as this just uses two strands and a series of elastics to create this gorgeous side braid.  Pair this hairstyle with a less fancy dress to add some pop and get everyone talking about your hair! 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGH3PromStyles

videos.title: Bailey's Double Dutch Buns Hair Tutorial | Hairstyles for Short Hair
videos.description:
Its me, Bailey, and I am back to teach y'all one of my favorite hair tutorials, for short hair, the Double Dutch Buns! If you know how to Dutch Braid, then this hairstyle will be easy! Click above to see how I create this cute and adorable hairstyle!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHDblDutchBuns

Many of you have been asking for more short hairstyle tutorials, so my mom asked me if I could show you one of my go-to hairstyles for school. I love the look of space buns, but those of us with short hair don't have enough hair length to pull those off. If we try, we are left with waterspout pigtails on top, which isn't what we want.

So several months ago I was playing around with my hair when I stumbled upon something that works very well, and is still cute! Moving the buns to the base of the head give you just enough length for a bun. I love Dutch Braids, because you can pancake them super pretty, to give you an added Boho, bohemian look.

You can dress this hairstyle up or down, depending on how you are dressed, and you can pretty much use any braid style as part of the combo. (Instead of Dutch braids, you can use French Braids, pull-through braids, etc.

videos.title: Side Triple Flower | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Today's video is great as it is a simple and easy hairstyle for beginners.  You can do this easy hairstyle for long hair or as an easy hairstyle for medium hair.  I've used this braided bun hairstyle on myself as an easy DIY hairstyle or on my daughters!  My daughters have even done this hairstyle on each other since it's an easy hairstyle for kids to do!
What makes this hairstyle simple is that you only need to know how to do a regular braid in order to create the great side braid look.  As this hairstyle is so easy, it is also quick which means that you can use this hairstyle as a great go-to for an easy hairstyle for school. 

To begin this hairstyle you need to part off one small section of hair next to the ear.  Then divide this section into three smaller sections.  Pin two of the sections out of the way.  

With the free section of hair, begin a simple braid.  When you have the braid completed gently tug on one side of the braid to pop the edge of the braid outward.  Secure the braid with an elastic leaving the ends in the elastic to create a loop.  Use the loop and begin to roll the braid up into a bun.  

Secure the bun against the head with bobby pins.  Repeat these steps with the other two braids to create a triangle shape of rosette looking buns.  
This easy hairstyle for girls is sure to impress and would love fabulous in so many settings!  Prepare for compliments!  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHSideTripleFlower

videos.title: 3 Easy Headband Hairstyles | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
I love winter because it makes throwing on a hat or a headband so easy and simple in the mornings.  In this video I will show you three simply and easy hairstyles for wearing headbands.  Pair any of these hairstyles with a cute sweater or jacket and you are ready for the day!

The first headband hairstyle is a darling bun wrapped with a braid.  This easy hairstyle still has a sophisticated look to it that you can wear to work or other dressier events.  

The second headband hairstyle is two stacked fishtails.  I love this style for a soft, boho feel that will work with any soft, knit headband.  If you don't want to stack the braids simply do two fishtails for a similar effect.  

The third hairstyle is a cute sporty pull thru ponytail.  Add a headband and you will be ready for any winter sporting events, a day on the ski slopes, or a fun day out and about.

videos.title: Wrapped Pull Thru Braid | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
One of my all time favorite hairstyles is the Pull Thru Braid.  So when I learned this version I knew I had to show others too!  This hairstyle tutorial is perfect for any occasion including a Homecoming dance hairstyle, a prom hairstyle, a simple every day hairstyle, or even an athletic hairstyle.

Begin this hairstyle by creating a french braid on each side of the head.  I don't add in much hair and when I run out of hair at the end I simply secure with an elastic.  

Now I take a small section of hair near the back of my head and add an elastic.  I like to poof this section to add some volume and fulness to my hairstyle.  This also gives me the base of the pull-thru braid.  

Create an entire pull thru braid with the remainer of the hair.  Be sure to pancake the hair as you go to add even more fullness!  Now I take the beginning french braids and lay them over the top of the pull thru. Use bobby pins to secure the braids to the back of your head.  

Once they are secure I roll the braid up and into a ball and tuck it under the braids to hide the ends.  Again use bobby pins to secure.  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHWrappedPullThru

videos.title: Holiday Twisted Updo | Holiday Hairstyle | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Halloween is over and the Thanksgiving holiday and Christmas holiday are just around the corner.  With the holidays come parties!  Which means you need to look amazing in your holiday hairstyle and holiday clothes!  
Today I'm showing you a simple and basic holiday hairstyle tutorial that you can do in no time flat.  This style would look great as a holiday hairstyle for medium hair or a holiday hairstyle for long hair.  If you pair this holiday hair with some holiday makeup you are sure to get many compliments!

To begin section off two areas of hair near each ear.  Secure the rest of the hair at the nape of the neck into a messy bun.  On the light side of the head create a rope twist.  Twist it back against the head and over the top of the bun and bobby pin into place.  
On the heavy hair side of the head take half of the hair and first create a braid.  Secure the braid with an elastic and bobby pin into place over the bun and twist from before.  

With the remaining hair create another rope twist.  Hold onto a small piece at the bottom of the twist and push upward to pancake the twist into nice pretty waves.  Secure this with bobby pins just beneath the braid.  

You now have great holiday hair!  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHHolidayTwistedUpdo

videos.title: Side Elastic Braid | DIY Hairstyles | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Whether you're looking for a homecoming hairstyle or an everyday look, this side elastic braid is one of my absolute favorite hairstyles! This DIY hairstyle may look complicated, but in reality it is super simple and quick to do! You will love this look for a prom hairstyle, a holiday party hairstyle, or even a romantic beach hairstyle look  

To recreate this DIY hairstyle tutorial you begin by creating a lace braid on the side of the head near the temple.  Only adding hair into the one side of the braid.  Then I go back and pancake the hair to add fullness and fluff.  

Once the lace braid is secure then I take the lace braid and another small piece of hair from the other side.  Secure them together.  

From this point on you just need to take one piece of hair from each side, twist the hair, and then secure them with an elastic.  Go back and tug on the hair to loosen the twists and make it look so pretty and full.  

The ease comes from you only needing to use a few elastics and twists.  But the braid itself looks so amazing and beautiful.  It looks like a fancy french braid or a fax french braid.

videos.title: ü¶Ñ Unicorn Half-Up Hairstyle | DIY Halloween Costumes | Cute Girls Hairstyles ü¶Ñ
videos.description:
I'm so in love with our Halloween hairstyles so far this year!  But there was something truly magical in the air when we filmed this unicorn hairstyle!  I've always wanted to try unicorn hair after being a little girl and being obsessed with My Little Pony :)  I've been so happy that My Little Pony and unicorns are coming back as current trends! 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHUnicornHair

Every year I love Halloween time, and Halloween 2016 is no exception!  There's something about the fall weather, the pumpkins and mums, football, and of course the Halloween costumes and Halloween makeup.  But I'm an especially big fan of creating amazing hairstyles for Halloween to go with our great costumes for Halloween!  Which is why we created this CGH Spooktorials series! 

I know that around this time of year everyone begins looking for hairstyle ideas for Halloween, DIY costumes ideas, last minute costumes, and Halloween makeup ideas.  So I thought I'd make it easy by continuing our Spooktorials and filming some great DIY Halloween videos, DIY costumes, and some great DIY hairstyles.  

Obviously we focus on the hairstyle tutorials on this channel, but you will be able to find lots of great DIYs, costume ideas, and other great Halloween-oriented videos between our channel, the BrooklynAndBailey channel, and the KamriNoel channel.  

But it wasn't till this year that I found the perfect unicorn hairstyle tutorial to teach for all of you!  Out of all my Spooktorials, this one might be my very favorite!  

I begin this Halloween hairstyle (which can easily be done as a DIY hairstyle) by parting her hair down the middle.  I then pulled each side into high ponytails, then divided the ponytail into two sections (one section with about 1/3 of the hair and one section with about 2/3 of the hair).  I straightened the 1/3 section of hair and left it down to fall next to her face and add some softness to her unicorn costume.  With the remaining 2/3 of hair I created a regular braid, pancaked the braid, and twisted it into a bun.  I used bobby pins to secure the braid into a bun.  Then repeated these steps on the other side of the head.  

For added effect with her unicorn look and awesome Halloween costume, I sprayed her hair with silver-colored hair spray and added some glitter to her part line.  Last, but not least, I added a beautiful silver unicorn horn circlet that I found online looking for halloween costume ideas.  

Hope you enjoy this hairstyle for halloween as much as I do! Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëçüèª" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us which of all our Spooktorials is your favorite!

üíã's -Mindy

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, bobby pins, small hair elastics, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 3-5 minutes

Skill Level: Easy

videos.title: Half-Up Half-Down Bun Combo Hairstyle | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Today's Half-up half-down bun combo hairstyle is great as a hairstyle for long hair, a hairstyle for medium hair, or even a hairstyle for short hair with just a little modification!  

Everybody loves a great boho hairstyle that they can even wear as a homecoming hairstyle, a hairstyle for school, or even a holiday hairstyle.  

In this tutorial watch as I, Jordan a guest hairstyle contributor to Cute Girls Hairstyles, create a half up half down hairstyle.  I begin by creating a small inverse fishtail braid and then make it look even more amazing by working it to become a pancaked braid. Cute Girls Hairstyles has a fishtail braid tutorial and a french fishtail braid tutorial on their channel if you don't know how :)

After finishing the fishtail braid, I pull some of the hair back to create a ponytail hairstyle and then secure the fishtail braid into the ponytail as well.  

Now we are ready to create our half up half down bun.  
Using bobby pins I wrap the hair around the half up half down to create a half up bun shape.  

Now begin creating a three strand braid on one side of your half up half down hairstyle.  I think this style looks even better with several braids so I added another braid on the second side of my hairstyle. Don't forget to pancake the braids a little for added fullness and fun!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHHalfBunCombo

If you missed BrooklynAndBailey's "Pajama Party" LIVEstream this past week, click HERE to watch it! http://youtu.be/sPGukkeBaCw
__

Today, Rylan and I will be showing you how to create a 4-Strand French Braid Pinback. This is not a new braid style {you can find it everywhere}, however it is the first time that we've shown you how to create it.

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGH4StrandFrench

I particularly love this braid as an accent, as seen here, but you also could do these as Frenchbacks into braids or ponytails on both sides... very versatile braids that work great in many hairstyle combos!

videos.title: Rick Rack Braid | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Click HERE to watch BrooklynAndBailey's "Parent Trap Parody" & "Prom Dress Gone Wrong" comedy collab with StudioC! http://youtu.be/unFAHooh_zE?list=UU6QWhGQqf0YDYdRb0n6ojWw

This braided hairstyle is inspired by the rick rack ribbon used in both the sewing and quilting worlds. {We've shown you this technique a long time ago, in our Textured Braids tutorial back in 2013... http://youtu.be/EVX_7Qq_y6s}

Rick Rack is literally defined by Webster's Dictionary as "a flat braid to form zigzags and used especially as trimming on clothing." 

Our tutorial today uses the Rick Rack braid as a simple pinback with Kamri's straight hair. Although the braid looks fairly complex, it really is one of the easiest to create. If you know how to braid a simple 3-strand braid, then this one is going to be easy for you!

To see your own photo recreations of this hairstyle featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHRickRackBraid

We use this braid as an accent, simply because it has so much already going on with it. This braid could also be cute as a tieback. 

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëç" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us if you've watched the twins' Parent Trap parody video {link at the top of description box}!

videos.title: Braided Half Up | Hairstyles for Prom
videos.description:
BONUS VIDEO! Be sure to check back here this coming Wednesday night, to see a bonus family video! It'll be a Room Tour of Daxton & Paisley's room! Paisley is so excited for you to see her new bed!

With Prom season right upon us, the girls and I wanted to give you an easy half-up hairstyle perfect for the dance. This is an updated variation of our Pancake Braids w/Sock Curls tutorial that we put up years ago {http://youtu.be/XUo47UiPh3Y}.

We began by curling Brooklyn's hair with a wand, and helping set the curls with hairspray. For the accents, you can use any type of braids you want, but I feel the best are Dutch Fishtails and 3-strand Dutch Braids. {This is because they pancake the best.} For this tutorial, and for the sake of time, we used Dutch Braids here.

The twins are not going to Prom this year, since they have chosen to not date until they are 16, but they are helping several of their upper classmate girls to do their hair for the night! 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHBraidedHalfUp

This would also make a wonderful Festival Hairstyle, something you could wear to Coachella or a medieval or renaissance fair. It pretty much looks great for any occasion!

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëç" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us if you would like to see me post a Prom Prep & Texture tutorial!

üíã's -Mindy

videos.title: The Tuxedo Braid | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Watch our family vlog from our Spring Break in Dubai, by clicking HERE!
https://youtu.be/vNGDv0zPths

This braid has been on my list for about 8 months, one that we've done from time to time on the girls after seeing it on the red carpet. 

Kamri calls this the Tuxedo Braid, because the inside Dutch Braid looks like the ruffles of a vintage tuxedo, with the outer loose French Braid acting like the jacket of the tux.

This braid, having been around awhile, has also been called a Peek-A-Boo Braid.  I am not sure where the style originated, but recently Diane Kruger wore it to the 2014 Fashion Awards show.  One of our viewers, Gabi, even emailed me a photo for a much more relaxed version of this from Cosmopolitan magazine's website {http://www.cosmopolitan.com/style-beauty/beauty/how-to/a31363/hair-how-to-peek-a-boo-braid/}.  We decided to bump it up the list and finally film a tutorial on it.  While I like Cosmo's interpretation, the one we've done has always been a higher hide of the Dutch Braid, just like a tux's jacket. Thanks for the nudge, Gabi!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHTuxedoBraid

I would recommend trying this hairstyle on someone else first, just to get the hang of the centering for both braids. You can do it tight, or loose, it all depends on the look you are trying to create. Feel free to use hairspray or spray wax to help hold in flyaways.

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëç" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us if you've watched our family's Spring Break in Dubai vlog {link above}.

üíã's -Mindy

Skill Level: Medium

videos.title: The Dragon Braid | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
See fan hairstyle photos featured on our Instagram, plus more family photos by following below!
http://www.instagram.com/CuteGirlsHairstyles

Happy Easter! Our outfit links are below!  This week's hairstyle is nothing new, you've seen it around everywhere on the catwalk and in magazines. I've even seen a photo tutorial by LalasUpdos on IG, but we've never filmed a tutorial for it. 

This style is called the Dragon Braid as the Pancaked Dutch Lace Braids mimic the bumpy scales down the spine of the dragon, much like you see down the backs and tails of alligators and crocodiles today.

Brooklyn was my model today, and wears this braid on days she plans on being active. We categorize this style as "Hard" due to the overdirecting of the braid along the part lines. Once you have that down, this braid is a cinch!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHDragonBraid

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "üëç" if you loved it, and leave a comment below letting us know your favorite part of Spring!

Today's Viking Braid hairstyle uses a pancaked Dutch Braid, which is then included in a fluffy ponytail.

We started with 2nd-day curls, because we didn't want the hairstyle to have too much volume. The rest of the steps are super easy to follow.

videos.title: How to Create a Banded Puff Braid | Cute Hairstyles
videos.description:
Click this link to watch BrooklynAndBailey's "Meet our Little Brother" video: http://youtu.be/-prosDBMIKs

Please give the video a "Like" if you think Brooklyn looks gorgeous in the intro! {Goal: 20,000 Likes}
_________________________

A few months ago my friend from high school, Alicia, shared a photo with me of this hairstyle that she simply could not figure out. At first, I couldn't either. 

It took a few weeks, but the girls and I finally cracked the code, and want to share with you how to create this beautiful faux braid hairstyle!

You are actually using small banded tiebacks to create this style, threading your newest one under and up through, and over the top of the previous one. Then as you go, you pancake the stitches. You can do as few or many as you want, it is entirely up to you!

It may seem confusing at first, as it was for me, but as you go along, the puff braid will take shape and you will LOVE it!

To see your own photo recreations featured in our app, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle on IG with: #CGHBandedPuffBraid

We are stopped every time we go out when one of us wears this braid! You can leave this as is, or finish the bottom ponytail into a braid and tuck and roll it all up and underneath the puff braid for a beautiful updo. Your options really are limitless!

What do you think of this hairstyle? Feel free to leave a comment below!

üíã's -Mindy

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 10-12 small hair elastics, hairspray or hair wax, accessory {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 15-20 minutes

Skill Level: Medium

To see step-by-step instructions and more photos of this style, please visit... http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com

We later found a tutorial on YouTube that appears to be the inspiration for Alicia's photo! Wish we had seen it sooner, as it would've saved me some serious time! http://youtu.be/E7hvGqQfhgE

videos.description:
Be sure to enter BrooklynAndBailey's Back-to-School Backpack Givewaway here: http://youtu.be/Ku_Khqy2ApQ?list=UU6QWhGQqf0YDYdRb0n6ojWw

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

This braid concept is nothing new, in fact we filmed a Side Fishtail Combo featuring this concept back in 2011. Looks like it finally made traction!

If you know how to fishtail braid, pancake it, and add a mini hair wrap... then this will be easy! Here I will show you a trick to securing the hair wraps, and we incorporated the bubble ponytail look from a previous video, with multiple segments here, to enhance the combo.

To see your recreations of this hairstyle featured in our app, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHBubbleFishtail

We chose for this to be a half-up, half-down hairstyle, with light curls as the base. For younger girls, you can pull all the hair into it from above the ears, leaving the rest down. This will give a more pulled-back look.

You can add as many bubble segments as you wish, which will mostly depend on the length of your hair.

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 3 small hair elastics, 2 bobby pins, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 5-7 minutes

Skill Level: Medium

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

As Spring is full underway, with lots of Proms going one, Kamri and I wanted to teach you a variation of a style we showed you last year. This is called a 3D Flower Bun.

To see our original 3D Round Braid, click here: http://youtu.be/eeCOdeC7S7k

We use the exact 3D Round Braid as the base of this hairstyle, however my good friend Abby Smith {http://www.youtube.com/TwistMePretty} suggested us to add a "pancake" accent to it.  All you have to do is gently tug "pancake" on the elbows of the braid, to add volume to the braid, and then wrap it up around itself into a bun. This creates a gorgeous flower bun effect, with the pancaking acting as flower petals!

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGH3DFlowerBun

Yes, lots of compliments on this one... GUARANTEED! Thanks to Kamri for volunteering to be our model!

Enjoy!

videos.title: Stacked Twist Ponytail | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Don't forget to follow CGH and BrooklynAndBailey on Instagram to see more behind-the-scenes photos!

http://www.instagram.com/CuteGirlsHairstyles
http://www.instagram.com/BrooklynAndBailey

Tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHStackedTwist

A few months ago we showed you how to create the Stacked Braid, and it has been very popular!  Click here to see that tutorial...  http://youtu.be/eRx2UjRjYDw

At the same time, we tried stacking the base braid with a rope braid twist on top and it is equally as cute!  You simply use the same technique in stacking the twist, only that you only pull out strands from the inside of the right most strand as you go down {to later incorporate in your stacked twist} rather than strands from both sides as in the stacked braids.  The video will make this clear.

My girls have worn this for several months and it gets just as many compliments as the Stacked Braids, only people are more curious at how the twist stays on top!  Try it, and see what your friends think!

Enjoy!

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

I have been working these past few weeks on a few updo hairstyle ideas, and this is the first one.

Many of you know that my girls LOVE "pancaked" braids... so we decided to film this updo incorporating one.  As you know, pancake braid is essentially a braid with the elbows tugged out, expanding/flattening the braid.  {We Dutch braided from the top of the head all the way down the back.}

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHDoubleTwistPancake

We then took two sections on either side of the head and twisted them, messed them up a bit, and twisted them around the bottom of the pancake braid, and pinned them.  

The finished look is beautiful!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 1 small elastic band, 2-4 bobby pins, hairspray or accessory {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 5-7 minutes

videos.title: Pancake Braids w/ Sock Curls | Bohemian Hair | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
To see more photos of this style, please visit...
http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com

Want to become a "Super Fan" of the week, and potentially have your photo appear in a future video?  Simply email us a photo of you doing something crazy or fun while wearing a CGH t-shirt!  Grab our gear here...

http://www.twitter.com/CuteGirlHair
http://www.pinterest.com/MrsHairdo
http://www.instagram/CuteGirlsHairstyles

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

We added a little flair in our Sock Curls Hairstyle tutorial a few weeks ago, and so many of you fans noticed and subsequently requested that we show you what we did!  Fortunately, we actually filmed these Bohemian "Pancake" Braids that very same day, so here you go!

We used the Sock Curls as the base for this hairstyle, or you can use the Headband Curls as well, but if you have not seen how to create those gorgeous "no-heat" curls, you can see it here... http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CzJKdHglFck

Now, this braiding technique is so simple and we call the resulting braids are "Pancake Braids".  My girls gave the name simply because the braids are flat like pancakes {kids are creative!}.  So, you have my girls to thank for the name!  You just create a normal 3-strand braid, braided loosely, and then go back and tug out the elbows in the braid {which flattens the braid} before securing with an elastic.

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHPancakeBraids

In this hairstyle, we did two pancake braids from the front/sides and then brought them back and pinned them up to create this beautiful Bohemian look.  I promise you will get compliments on this hairstyle!

Enjoy!
